what: Fit a Cox model with gene-environment interaction under weak hierarchy constraint.
title: HierFabs: SKCM Data Analysis with Cox-GE model
text: , can use print function show result.
code: y = data$y status = data$status E = as.matrix(data$E) G = as.matrix(data$G) fit <- HierFabs(E, y, G, model = "cox", eps = 0.01, hier = "weak", status = status, diagonal = TRUE,     max_s = 40, criteria = "BIC") print(fit) #> 5 x 20 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>                                                                            #> main effect                    . title: HierFabs: installation
text: vignette provides introduction R package HierFabs, function HierFabs implements model. completely newly developed forward backward steps accommodate hierarchy, HierFabs able detect important main effects interactions strong weak hierarchy. Advancing existing studies, HierFabs accommodates multiple types interaction models differentiable loss functions unified framework. package can installed following command Github: install.packages('devtools') devtools::install_github("XiaoZhangryy/HierFabs") package can loaded command:

what: A General Framework for Identifying Hierachical Interaction of Genomics Data interaction of genomics data
title: A General Framework for Identifying Hierachical Interaction of Genomics Data interaction of genomics data
text: hierarchical Forward Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm identifying hierachical interaction genomics data HierFabs uses coordinate descent fixed step size consists forward backward steps. step, first-order Taylor’s expansion used reflect main part increment.

title: A General Framework for Identifying Hierachical Interaction of Genomics Data interaction of genomics data
A General Framework for Identifying Hierachical Interaction of Genomics Data interaction of genomics data
A General Framework for Identifying Hierachical Interaction of Genomics Data interaction of genomics data
code: library(HierFabs)  set.seed(0) n = 500 p = 100 x = matrix(rnorm(n*p),n,p) eta = x[,1:4] %*% rep(1,4) + 3*x[,1]*x[,2] + 3*x[,1]*x[,4] y =  eta + rnorm(n) xtest = matrix(rnorm(n*p),n,p) eta.test = xtest[,1:4] %*% rep(1,4) + 3*xtest[,1]*xtest[,2] + 3*xtest[,1]*xtest[,4] ytest =  eta.test + rnorm(n) fit.gg.strong = HierFabs(x, y) y.pred.gg.s = predict(fit.gg.strong, xtest, ytest) y.pred.gg.s$mse print(fit.gg.strong)  ## Weak hierarchy fit.gg.weak = HierFabs(x, y, hier="weak") y.pred.gg.w = predict(fit.gg.weak, xtest, ytest) y.pred.gg.w$mse print(fit.gg.weak)  ## Cox model with Gene-Environment interactions pz = 10 z = matrix(rnorm(n*pz),n,pz) eta.ge = x[,1:4] %*% rep(1,4) + z[,1] + z[,2] + 3*x[,1]*z[,1] + 3*x[,2]*z[,2] err = log(rweibull(n, shape = 1, scale = 1)) y0 = exp(-eta.ge + err) cens = quantile(y0, 0.9) y.ge = pmin(y0, cens) status = 1 * (y0<=cens) ztest = matrix(rnorm(n*pz),n,pz) eta.ge.test = rowSums(xtest[,1:4]) + ztest[,1] + ztest[,2] eta.ge.test = eta.ge.test + 3*xtest[,1]*ztest[,1] + 3*xtest[,2]*ztest[,2] err.test = log(rweibull(n, shape = 1, scale = 1)) y0.test = exp(-eta.ge.test + err.test) cens = quantile(y0.test, 0.9) y.ge.test = pmin(y0.test, cens) status.test = 1 * (y0.test<=cens) fit.ge.strong = HierFabs(x, y.ge, z, model="cox", status=status) y.pred.ge.s = predict(fit.ge.strong, xtest, y.ge.test, ztest, status.test) y.pred.ge.s$c.index print(fit.ge.strong)  ## Weak hierarchy fit.ge.weak = HierFabs(x, y.ge, z, model="cox", status=status, hier="weak") y.pred.ge.w = predict(fit.ge.weak, xtest, y.ge.test, ztest, status.test) y.pred.ge.w$c.index print(fit.ge.weak)

title: A General Framework for Identifying Hierachical Interaction of Genomics Data interaction of genomics data

what: A hierarchical Forward and Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm for identifying hierachical interaction of genomics data. — HierFabs
title: A hierarchical Forward and Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm for identifying hierachical interaction of genomics data. — HierFabs
text: hierarchical Forward Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm identifying hierachical interaction genomics data.

title: A hierarchical Forward and Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm for identifying hierachical interaction of genomics data. — HierFabs
code: HierFabs(   G,   y,   E,   weight = NULL,   model = c("gaussian", "cox", "quantile", "logistic"),   back = TRUE,   stoping = TRUE,   eps = 0.01,   xi = 10^-6,   iter = 3000,   lambda.min = NULL,   hier = c("strong", "weak"),   max_s = NULL,   diagonal = FALSE,   status = NULL,   gamma = NULL,   tau = NUL,   criteria = c("EBIC", "BIC") )

title: A hierarchical Forward and Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm for identifying hierachical interaction of genomics data. — HierFabs
text: G Gene matrix, row observation vector. y Response variable. logistic regression model, y takes value 1 -1. E optional environment matrix. Z given, interactions environment gene interest. Otherwise, gene-gene interactions interest. weight optional weights. Default 1 observation. model character string representing one built-models. 'gaussian' linear model 'cox' cox model. back indicator whether take backward steps. stoping indicator whether stop iteration lambda less lambda.min. eps Step size. Default 0.01. xi tolerate improve program stability. Default 10^-6. iter Maximum number outer-loop iterations allowed. Default 3000. lambda.min Smallest value lambda, fraction lambda.max. hier Whether enforce strong weak heredity. Default 'strong'. max_s Limit maximum number variables model. exceed limit, program early stopped. diagonal indicator whether include "pure" quadratic terms. Work gene-gene interactions interest. status censoring indicator. gamma tuning parameter EBIC. tau parameter quantile regression. criteria criteria used select optimal solution.

title: A hierarchical Forward and Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm for identifying hierachical interaction of genomics data. — HierFabs
text: list. theta - coefficients covariates, column solution. beta - optimal solution. lambda - Lambda sequence. direction - Update indicator. 1 means take forward step, -1 means take backward step. iter - Number iterations. EBIC - EBIC solution. loss - loss solution. df - Number nonzero coefficients. opt - Position optimal tuning based EBIC. intercept - intercept term, appearance due standardization.

title: A hierarchical Forward and Backward Stagewise (HierFabs) algorithm for identifying hierachical interaction of genomics data. — HierFabs
code: set.seed(0) n = 500 p = 100 x = matrix(rnorm(n*p),n,p) eta = x[,1:4] %*% rep(1,4) + 3*x[,1]*x[,2] + 3*x[,1]*x[,4] y =  eta + rnorm(n) xtest = matrix(rnorm(n*p),n,p) eta.test = xtest[,1:4] %*% rep(1,4) + 3*xtest[,1]*xtest[,2] + 3*xtest[,1]*xtest[,4] ytest =  eta.test + rnorm(n) fit.gg.strong = HierFabs(x, y) y.pred.gg.s = predict(fit.gg.strong, xtest, ytest) y.pred.gg.s$mse #> [1] 1.060471 print(fit.gg.strong) #> 4 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>    main effect      G2      G4 #> G1     0.86902 2.94975 2.95852 #> G2     0.84403 .       .       #> G3     0.83112 .       .       #> G4     0.93636 .       .        ## Weak hierarchy fit.gg.weak = HierFabs(x, y, hier="weak") y.pred.gg.w = predict(fit.gg.weak, xtest, ytest) y.pred.gg.w$mse #> [1] 1.107333 print(fit.gg.weak) #> 4 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>    main effect      G2      G4 #> G1     0.83871 2.92996 2.93195 #> G2     0.81424 .       .       #> G3     0.80107 .       .       #> G4     0.90827 .       .        ## Cox model with Gene-Environment interactions pz = 10 z = matrix(rnorm(n*pz),n,pz) eta.ge = x[,1:4] %*% rep(1,4) + z[,1] + z[,2] + 3*x[,1]*z[,1] + 3*x[,2]*z[,2] err = log(rweibull(n, shape = 1, scale = 1)) y0 = exp(-eta.ge + err) cens = quantile(y0, 0.9) y.ge = pmin(y0, cens) status = 1 * (y0<=cens) ztest = matrix(rnorm(n*pz),n,pz) eta.ge.test = rowSums(xtest[,1:4]) + ztest[,1] + ztest[,2] eta.ge.test = eta.ge.test + 3*xtest[,1]*ztest[,1] + 3*xtest[,2]*ztest[,2] err.test = log(rweibull(n, shape = 1, scale = 1)) y0.test = exp(-eta.ge.test + err.test) cens = quantile(y0.test, 0.9) y.ge.test = pmin(y0.test, cens) status.test = 1 * (y0.test<=cens) fit.ge.strong = HierFabs(x, y.ge, z, model="cox", status=status) y.pred.ge.s = predict(fit.ge.strong, xtest, y.ge.test, ztest, status.test) y.pred.ge.s$c.index #> [1] 0.914657 print(fit.ge.strong) #> 7 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>             main effect      E1      E2 #> main effect     .       0.63192 0.64792 #> G1              0.60630 1.88923 .       #> G2              0.54614 .       1.92648 #> G3              0.64086 .       .       #> G4              0.60864 .       .       #> G24             0.02830 .       .       #> G53             0.02939 .       .        ## Weak hierarchy fit.ge.weak = HierFabs(x, y.ge, z, model="cox", status=status, hier="weak") y.pred.ge.w = predict(fit.ge.weak, xtest, y.ge.test, ztest, status.test) y.pred.ge.w$c.index #> [1] 0.9148998 print(fit.ge.weak) #> 9 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>             main effect      E1      E2 #> main effect     .       0.61186 0.61755 #> G1              0.57598 1.82142 .       #> G2              0.52628 .       1.86564 #> G3              0.62083 .       .       #> G4              0.58055 .       .       #> G24             0.01887 .       .       #> G53             0.01959 .       .       #> G32             .       0.00994 .       #> G59             .       0.02020 .
